Author: x2
Content:

The website says "This page is parked free"

Author: juwo
Content: Be clear about this: a tax deduction is not dollar for dollar. i.e. is NOT free. You are simply getting a discount based on your tax bracket. (this is for the posters from the U.K.)

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content: According to my lawyer, the large body of prior precedent in Delaware is the reason: i.e. if you ever wind up in a legal dispute, your attorneys will have a good sense of how your case would be ruled, based on similar case precedent(s).

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
New York Angels (http://newyorkangels.com/) has a similar application (unlike YC, there's no deadline, and they'll accept an applicant at any time, but they charge a fee).

I haven't gone through the process myself, but I saw their pitch at a NYC tech panel a few months ago.

Author: jkush
Content: Heh. There ARE some good ones there - but looking back at some of my very first lines of code...I can't laugh TOO hard.

Author: joshwa
Content: This is actually one of the biggest strikes against YC in my pro/con table... I will likely have to take some F/F/F money in addition to the YC seed to make sure I will stay insured...

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
Beyond the money, the reason to work with VCs and angels (in theory) is for their connections and deal making clout.

The last several acquisitions Google made (YouTube and JotSpot most notably) were, supposedly, driven by the VCs of those firms.

I'd be interested to hear more anecdotes from the field (or any comments debunking that), so does anyone have an experience they can share?

Author: dpapathanasiou
Content:
Even without extending RSS (which I think is a good idea), there is still a lot of potential in "remixing" existing feeds to personal tastes.

Pipes is one way, SeekSift.com (my company's service) is another, but I don't think anyone's got it quite right yet.
